recap_documents.description: Chief Judge Patti B. Saris: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER entered. "ORDER: The Court ALLOWS defendants' motions for summary judgment (Docs. Nos.  83  &  90 ) and DENIES plaintiffs' motion for summary judgment and permanent injunctive relief (Doc. No.  87 )."  (LaFlamme, Jennifer)

OPINION AND ORDER signed by Judge James S. Gwin on 8/2/11. The Court, for the reasons set forth in this entry, denies Defendant Rumsfeld's motion to dismiss plaintiff's substantive due process claim and grants Defendant Rumsfeld's moti on to dismiss plaintiff's procedural due process and access to courts claims. The government's motion to dismiss plaintiff's return of seized property claim is granted and plaintiff is granted leave to amend his complaint if he can ple ad, in good faith, factual allegations supporting a reasonable inference that the government's refusal to return his property was a final agency decision. Lastly, the Court denies the government's motion for a more definite statement of plaintiff's right to travel claim. (Related Docs.  11 ,  12 ,  14 ,  15 ) (Gwin, James) (Gwin, James)
